Package com.intellij.codeInsight.editorActions

Interface QuoteHandler

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    JavaLikeQuoteHandler, MultiCharQuoteHandler
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BaseQuoteHandler, CustomFileTypeQuoteHandler, GroovyQuoteHandler, HtmlQuoteHandler, JavaQuoteHandler, JsonQuoteHandler, MarkdownQuoteHandler, PythonQuoteHandler, ShQuoteHandler, SimpleTokenSetQuoteHandler, XmlQuoteHandler, XPathQuoteHandler

    public interface QuoteHandler
    Implement this interface for QuoteHandlerEP to provide "Insert pair quote" functionality for your language (controlled by CodeInsightSettings.AUTOINSERT_PAIR_QUOTE).

    All the checks are triggered on typing/removal of a single quote and out of the box the aforementioned functionality is supported only for ordinary strings enclosed in a single pair of quotes. In order to support string literals that start and end with multiple quotes see MultiCharQuoteHandler and BackspaceHandlerDelegate.

    See Also:
    CodeInsightSettings.AUTOINSERT_PAIR_QUOTE, QuoteHandlerEP, LanguageQuoteHandling, MultiCharQuoteHandler

    • Method Detail

      • isClosingQuote

        boolean isClosingQuote(HighlighterIterator iterator,
                       int offset)
        Checks whether there is the closing quote or the last one of the set of closing quotes of a string literal at the given offset.

        Upon insertion, this method is called before the quote is actually inserted in the editor in order to check whether it's going to be typed over an existing one closing a string literal and, thus, should be omitted (only the caret position will be adjusted in this case).

        Parameters:
        iterator - highlighting iterator at the state corresponding to the offset
        offset - the offset at which the quote is going to be inserted/deleted

      • isOpeningQuote

        boolean isOpeningQuote(HighlighterIterator iterator,
                       int offset)
        Checks whether there is the opening quote or the last one of the set of opening quotes of a string literal at the given offset.
        Parameters:
        iterator - highlighting iterator at the state corresponding to the offset
        offset - the offset at which the quote was inserted

      • hasNonClosedLiteral

        boolean hasNonClosedLiteral(Editor editor,
                            HighlighterIterator iterator,
                            int offset)
        Called after the quote has been inserted in the editor to check that it belongs to an empty string literal that has only the opening quote and therefore, can be completed by inserting the respective closing one.

        If both this method and isOpeningQuote(HighlighterIterator, int) return true, the respective closing quote will be inserted automatically.

        Parameters:
        editor - an editor instance where the quote was inserted
        iterator - highlighting iterator at the state corresponding to the offset
        offset - the offset at which the quote was inserted
        See Also:
        isOpeningQuote(HighlighterIterator, int)

      • isInsideLiteral

        boolean isInsideLiteral(HighlighterIterator iterator)
